alert.note: Alert for Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 19 at 5:45PM CDT until July 19 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL ITASCA COUNTY... At 544 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Taconite, or 10 miles northeast of Grand Rapids, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. This storm produced quarter-size hail 12 miles north of Grand Rapids at 532 PM. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Taconite around 555 PM CDT. Pengilly around 605 PM CDT. Keewatin and Nashwauk around 615 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Hart Lake, Calumet, Lawrence Lake, Swan Lake, Bovey, Marble and Hill Annex Mine State Park. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
